result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal L Mendoza Rangel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid within the first 10 months of Probation. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school. (35 hrs per week)

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

Not to use or possess of Alcohol, Illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.
No further law violations.
Provide Proof of money order and file with the Court by 8/5/2022.

timeConds.notes: Community Service to be completed in the first 10 months of Probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Crystal L Mendoza Rangel

records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Abigail J Broze
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:02 AM Defendant Crystal L Mendoza Rangel in court with attorney Abigail J. Broze.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
Withheld sentence

Term of Probation: 12 Months
Conditions of Probation:
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	Inform agent of all prescriptions;
-	Maintain full time employment (35 hours per week);
-	Maintain a valid Driver's License;
-	All prescriptions to be filled at the same pharmacy
-	Complete 50 hours of Community Service within the first 10 months of probation;
-	Provide proof of money order and file with the court by 8/5/22;
-	No further law violations.

COSTS:  $ 243.00

DR GOD Surcharge: $ 10.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation within the first 10 months of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to sign her bond by 1/28/2022, if not signed a warrant will be issued.

09:32 AM Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Crystal L Mendoza Rangel appeared by zoom audio means.    All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for audio conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Check Case scheduled for January 31, 2022.  Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
